summary: Lance W. Svendsen was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). He appears on multiple payroll certification reports from April 1978 to January 1979. These reports list his name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCA. The documents suggest he was a consistent employee of the committee during the period covered by the reports.
significance: Lance W. Svendsen's significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in these documents.
